svg.text: Showroom Demo Creator Workflow
INPUTS: What the Skill Asks For
• New demo or continue existing? (determines if index/overview/details needed)
• Target directory (default: content/modules/ROOT/pages/)
• Demo story planning (main message, audience, transformation story, metrics)
• Module details (file name, reference materials, target audience, demo parts)
• Key business value metrics and customer scenario
PROCESS: What the Skill Does
1. Reads demo verification prompts for business-focused quality
2. Analyzes reference materials and marketing content
3. For NEW demos: Generates index, overview, details, first demo module
4. For EXISTING demos: Generates next sequential module
5. Creates Know/Show structure for each demo part:
- KNOW: Business context, pain points, value proposition
- SHOW: Presenter instructions, what to demonstrate, talk tracks
6. Includes optional visual cues (architecture diagrams, slides)
7. Adds business value callouts and competitive differentiators
8. Uses proper AsciiDoc formatting with Red Hat style compliance
9. Updates nav.adoc with demo module entries
10. Asks if last module → generates conclusion with ROI summary if yes
11. Manages token output (writes files, shows brief confirmations only)
12. NO learner language - uses presenter-focused terminology only
OUTPUTS: What It Creates
For NEW demos:
✓ index.adoc - Presenter navigation hub
✓ 01-overview.adoc - Business context and presenter prep
✓ 02-details.adoc - Technical details and timing
✓ 03-module-01-*.adoc - First demo module with Know/Show structure
For LAST module:
✓ 0X-conclusion.adoc - ROI summary, next steps, Q&A guidance, references
All demos use Know/Show structure with business value messaging and presenter guidance
